title: Designing Flexible Science Learning Pathways Using Sequencing Instructional Techniques

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in foundational science education and practical application skills
context.additional_context: Action learning project where in-service elementary teachers directly apply sequence-based learning design in science education settings

learning_goals: Learners can explain the core differences between SCORM and workflow-based sequencing systems.
Learners can design flexible learning pathways tailored to individual learner needs.
Learners implement educational modules using smartphone-based sequencing tools in limited technological environments.
Learners develop case studies applying sequencing techniques to actual science classes through action learning.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
